title: ‘. . . What the End Will Be’ Review: A New Take on Dysfunction
sub_head: Mansa Ra’s play, about three generations of gay black men living under one roof at the Laura Pels Theatre, tweaks the family drama formula
body:
New York
Plays about spouses and siblings at loggerheads are such a staple of the American theater that the phrase “dysfunctional family drama,” in stage vernacular, might sensibly be reduced to “family drama.” Mansa Ra’s “. . . What the End Will Be,” a Roundabout Theatre Company production, spins a novel variation on this enduring genre by focusing on an unusually assorted clan: three generations of black gay men living under the same roof.
